docs.title: Home
docs.text:
Petersen Clinics Reporting

This site was established as a repository for PHC's monitoring and operational reporting code.

docs.title: Data Description
docs.text: Data used in these reports are downloaded foerm two sources. They contain PHI.

docs.title: Data Organization and Documentation
docs.text: Data are organized by download file, titled with the form/dataset name and date of extraction/download (yyyymmdd)

docs.title: Cerner Monthly Datasets
docs.text:
-demographics

-visits

-labs

-immunizations

-medications

docs.title: Castor Excel Export
docs.text: See downloaded excel file and readme under Castor data.

docs.title: Data Preservation and Long-Term Access
docs.text: Data sets are not to be preserved but overwritten as new data are pulled. Static downloads are downloaded monthly and maintained on BoxHealth.

docs.title: Data Sharing and Access
docs.text: Data are accessible by PHC approved staff only, sharing is only internal for patient management purposes. Reports files are sent directly to BoxHealth for staff access.

docs.title: Data Ethics and Legal Compliance
docs.text: Data used by these files contains PHI which is required for operational follow-up and resolution. Users of this code and these datasets must comply with UA HIPAA training requirements and additional internal PHC privacy and security training.

docs.title: Roles and Responsibilities
docs.text: The Data Specialist, Senior is responsible for all changes and change management. The Data Specialist also works with team members to incorporate chates, updates, new items to reports as needed.

docs.title: Budget and Resources
docs.text: There are no budget or resources for this project beyond project funding.

docs.title: Introduction
docs.text: The Petersen Clinics (PHC) are part of the Health Resources and Services Administration Ryan White Network which servces people with HIV (PWH) in the U.S. Monitoring and reporting activities require data from numerous sources to be compiled and acted on to ensure PWH are receiving the care they need.

docs.title: Project Overview and Objectives
docs.text: This repository stores the programmatic and operational Stata .do files that are run at regular intervals to ensure monitoring and reporting takes place.

docs.title: Team Overview and Organization Structure
docs.text:
The Data Specialist/Data Manager (DM) is reponsible for the scheduled running of reports. PHC staff are responsible for reviewing reports and taking action to ensure patient services are ongoing.

Descriptions of all reports are contained within the readme file within each reporting section.

docs.title: Operations
docs.text: See readme files for each reproting section for more information.

docs.title: Communications
docs.text: The Data Specialist/Data Manager (DM) is reponsible for coordinating updates and edits to code and supporting documentation.

docs.title: Procedures
docs.text: See readme files for each reproting section for more information.

docs.title: Open Science Commitment
docs.text: This code may be useful to other clinics for program or operational reporting.

docs.title: Code of Conduct
docs.text: Compliance with HIPAA, UA provacy/security.

docs.title: Attribution, Authorship, and Ownership
docs.text: No publications are allowed from these datasets.

docs.title: About this Site
docs.text: This repository stores documentation, instructions and .do files for running Petersen Clinics program and operational reporting.

docs.title: About Me
docs.text:
I'm an MS student in the UA Clinical Translational Sciences program focusing on improving methods of centralized statistical monitoring for clinical trials. I have over 20 years of clinical data management experience starting in 2001 as a Data Manager for the Botswana-Harvard Partnership for HIV/AIDS Research & Education in Botswana, primarily working on anti-retroviral treatment trials. Upon returning to the U.S. in 2019, I now support the Petersen HIV Clinics in the College of Medicine as a Data Specialist, Senior.

My passions are database development and ensuring collected data support the clinical project or program. I hope to leverage clinical trial metadata to better inform clinical researchers of their project’s status, improve data quality, and provide enhanced monitoring techniques.
